block_comment: The block of code is a state machine for an I2C initialization sequence. The sequence begins at the "AUTO_STATE_0_CHECK_STATUS" state where it checks if the initialization process is finished or if a flag from the ROM data is active. Depending on the condition, it transitions to either "AUTO_STATE_1_SEND_START_BIT", "AUTO_STATE_8_DONE", or "AUTO_STATE_3_TRANSFER_BYTE_1". It proceeds through more states which transfer bytes, wait for completion of tasks and increase counters. The final state, "AUTO_STATE_8_DONE", signifies the end of the sequence. It remains in each state until "change_state" is triggered. If unhandled conditions occur, it defaults back to the "AUTO_STATE_0_CHECK_STATUS" state.
